definition: Kang Sheng (1896-1975), Chinese communist leader, a politburo member during the Cultural Revolution and posthumously blamed for some of its excesses
surname Kang
healthy/peaceful/abundant
to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student

sentences.english: There will be more and more people living a well-to-do life.
sentences.chinese: 会有越来越多的人过上小康生活的。

sentences.english: This is in 2020, well-off life I.
sentences.chinese: 这就是2020年，小康生活的我。

sentences.english: As we know, handsome salary is very import for bread and milk.
sentences.chinese: 我们都知道，可观的工资对我们小康生活非常重要。

sentences.english: What is the exact dollar amount per month you need to live a well-off mobile lifestyle?
sentences.chinese: 每月你需要多少钱，才能过上小康生活？

definition: Chen Boda (1904-1989), communist party theorist, interpreter of Maoism
Zhang Chunqiao (1917-2005), one of the Gang of Four
Jiang Qing (1914-1991), Mao Zedong's fourth wife and leader of the Gang of Four
Yao Wenyuan (1931-2005), one of the Gang of Four
Liu Shaoqi (1898-1969), Chinese communist leader, a martyr of the Cultural Revolution
Wang Hongwen (1935-1992), one of the Gang of Four
Peng Zhen (1902-1997), Chinese communist leader
Hu Yaobang (1915-1989), Chinese politician
Hua Guofeng (1921-2008), leader of Chinese Communist Party after the Cultural Revolution
Bo Yibo (1908-2007), ranking PRC politician, served on State Council from 1950s to 1980s as colleague of Deng Xiaoping
Chen Yun (1905-1995), communist leader and economist
Zhang Wentian (1900-1976), CCP party leader and theorist
Zhou Enlai (1898-1976), Chinese communist leader, prime minister 1949-1976
Mao Zedong (1893-1976), Chinese communist leader
Zhang Shizhao (1881-1973), revolutionary journalist in Shanghai, then established writer
Zhang Guotao (1897-1979), Chinese communist leader in the 1920s and 1930s, defected to Guomindang in 1938
